hasVariant.description: Buy the RockShox Reverb XPLR AXS Dropper Seatpost online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are great, they remove the fuss of internal cable routing and make for a very quick install and easy to fine tune seat post height, or replace with regular seat post if you want to lighten up for certain ride.  The dropper function is great, fast and crisp down and return with the ability to fine tune at any set point in its travel.  The big issue is if you have a drop bar bike and don't have the AXS front shifter, you are going to have issues finding the right remote.  The MTB AXS remote won't fit on your drop bar and you'll need to purchase a wolf tooth shift mount for a 31.8 bar to use as an adapter.  Summary - if you don't have the AXS front shifter to connect to the dropper for control, your budget is going to go way up after you buy the remote and adapter so think this through carefully.  It may be worth just finding an AXS front shifter, but then you have to re-run your brake lines and bleed, which cancels out the advantage of not messing with internal dropper routing.  Otherwise the post is great but spendy and the value will come in how high your disdain is for messing with internally routed droppers.
review.name: Get your remote sorted first

name: Reverb XPLR AXS Dropper Seatpost

review.reviewBody: I bought this harness to replace an old BD one that was the predecessor to the Solution. My main concerns are that I’m 6’2 and 220lbs so taking whips on narrow waistbands can really take a toll. This harness has a nice double strap through the waistband that’s wider than most others without getting into big wall harness territory. Very comfy, on the wall and when falling. Folds down very compactly and the gear loops are in great spots. I’d like it to maybe have a little thicker padding through the waist, and the belay loop while being atypical has grown on me. It’s longer than the traditional stitched webbing ones, but really that just creates more room to have a second locker attached when getting into multi pitch.
review.name: Great Harness!

review.reviewBody: I've been using this harness for almost two seasons of climbing now and I really dig it. Lightweight, unobtrusive, and utilitarian. Perfect for shaving some bulk down when trad climbing. The hanging belays are not the most comfortable but they aren't especially uncomfortable either. While leading the harness becomes pretty much invisible and allows for total freedom of movement. Great harness overall.
review.name: Great Lightweight Harness

review.reviewBody:
I bought this as a replacement for my Arcteryx 395A as I had read some online comments suggesting it was very similar (and the 395a has been out of stock everywhere for a long time). This harness does not really compare well with the 395A in its fundamental design.  While it looks a tad similar, the waist band is more narrow and does not replicate the weight distribution properties of the Arcteryx technology at all.  It’s not the same and felt immediately uncomfortable while hanging similar to a traditional webbing based harness.  

Also the belay loop is ridiculously long (and thin).  It’s likely 50% longer than the 395a look and for sure 50% thinner.  The length causes the waist band to tend to ride up easier.  I understand the loop is using ultra high strength fibers but it’s thin feel is just not reassuring and will be particularly concerning one it sees some wear and tear.  I just don’t think that’s where I (or my partners) want to see weight saved.  For me, I had to return this harness.  It just is not a competitor for the 395A at all.
review.name: Might be good for some; not me.

name: Cuesta Adjustable Harness

review.name: Ski jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for my wife and she likes it. Excellent quality. Definitely recommend.
review.name: Excellent Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket was exactly what I was looking for: warm without being too bulky, all weather, looks and feels good for casual or sport use. My only gripe is that the black wrist and hand covers are too long. I have to uncomfortably tuck them up when wearing the coat casually. I may eventually remove them. Overall, a great jacket.
review.name: Great, all-around jacket

review.reviewBody: The fabric they used for the lining is extremely poor quality and pills after only 1 week of normal wear. The rest of the jacket is great and quite warm. The plastic zippers are not smooth, which is annoying. The lining is a major issue since it’s highly visible when wearing the jacket normally and not zipped all the way up. The rest of the jacket is great though, I wish they did not choose to use such cheap fabric for an area that’s not hidden. Bad quality. I am trying to submit a claim, but having a challenge uploading these photos.
review.name: Fabric pills and look terrible after 1 week
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product. In order to get a repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:

https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pretty similar to men's shadow jacket in terms of warmth, comfort and design. I am very satisfied with my shadow jacket so that's actually why I decided to get the slingshot jacket for my wife who tends to feel cold easily. She certainly loves it! When she wears it, she doesn't even need to layer too much to keep herself warm during Alaska winters. Definitely recommend both jackets.
review.name: Works Great For SC Alaska Winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this as a replacement for my Patagonia rubicon from many years ago.  I was looking for a warm ski coat that I could ski at the resort with out a ton of layering. Great fit, great pockets, helmet comp hood and a powder skirt. Super warm. I couldn’t have asked for more 5’5, 160 and I ordered a medium. I like the fit, could have gone with a large but wasn’t planning on layering much underneath. Lots of compliments on the hill!!
review.name: Great resort ski coat!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought 2 slingshot jackets.  One for myself and one for my daughter.  Best winter jackets for both of us.  The small size for my daughter and the Med for myself.  Perfect fit and very warm.
review.name: Best winter jacket is Slingshot jacket

review.reviewBody: Warm jacket. Has all the features of a snow sport jacket. Would prefer pit vent to have a mesh lining and not just a hole once it's opened. Zipper stuck when trying to zip up the pit vent. Not fond of the two chest Zipper pockets.
review.name: Nice but ...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket offers everything—waterproof, down, plenty of pockets, helmet compatible hood, AND pit zips!  5’4”, athletic build, 155lbs—size M.
review.name: Truly a unicorn!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits well with plenty of room to move around and not feel restricted. Comfortable and warm.
review.name: Good Overall Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I got this for my boyfriend for his birthday. He was SO happy and SHOCKED that I upgraded him to the 3-burner option because would have been happy with a single burner stove, let alone 2. 

I asked for his feedback and he said that he absolutely loves it, however it’s not quite perfect. He said that he wishes that there was an extra clasp designed in the center (picture a briefcase/suitcase) to help keep it securely closed. I did notice a TINY bit of gapping where it wouldn’t close shut all the way. 

According to the BF, the 2-burner stove in this exact model DOES have the extra clasp in the middle 🤔, so it’s puzzling why that center clasp is missing on the larger/heavier version? 

We chose not to return it. My boyfriend said that he LOVES it because it’s “almost” perfect just like him 🥹.  We truly love Coleman products and stand by them.
review.name: “Almost” Perfect

review.reviewBody: Very compact. Like that it uses propane. A dream to cook on. Thanks.
review.name: Three burner stove

review.reviewBody: Finally got to use my Coleman 3-burner for a tailgate. It worked better than expected and fit the griddle I had at home perfectly.
review.name: Nice Camping/Tailgate Grill!!

review.reviewBody: works well ,10-12 meals cooked so far at 8800 ft  hi
review.name: nice stove

review.reviewBody: Took this stove top camping and it did a good job. My biggest complaint is that you can’t control the heat very well. If you’re looking to simmer or need low heat forget this stove.

review.reviewBody: Amazing even heating. Love it with the griddle accessory. Glad I upgraded!
review.name: Great upgraded camp stove

review.reviewBody: I would agree with the other reviewer that this jersey runs more with regular clothing sizing than typical jersey sizing. I am 5'6" and the small fits, but not as tightly as my other jerseys (all size small). The main size surprise was that it is Long. Not necessarily a bad thing, just unexpected. The pattern is pretty and the mesh panels are super breathable.
review.name: Runs big (for a bike jersey)

review.reviewBody: The design is super pretty, but unfortunately this is too big. Jersey sizing is so hard to predict. In all normal clothes I'd be a medium, but for road jerseys I order a large in case they're sized for tiny road cyclists. This jersey probably runs normal sizing. I might have even gotten away with a small. I was also worried my phone was going to bounce out of the rear pockets because it was so baggy. There was also a zippered pocket back there, in my opinion, too many things going on. I also didn't love the blue mesh sides. It framed my chest in a sort of weird way.
review.name: Bummed it's too big

name: Adv Endur Graphic Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent bol, compact, facile à nettoyer, solide et stable. De plus il fait un excellent frisbee d'intérieur !
review.name: Ultimate frisbowl

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product, stores well, super light, easy to pop in and out.
review.name: super handy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought four of these bowls along with the collapsible pot, and they all nest perfectly inside it. We took them on a recent backpacking trip and they were exactly what I wanted.
review.name: Great bowl

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have several items from the first generation of collapsable bowls and plates. This version is a huge improvement in form and function. Snappy deployment. Rounded transition at bottom is a winner. Seems more sturdy when opened. Cleanup is easier also due to reduced silicone usage and more hard plastic. Keep innovating!
review.name: Big improvement from previous version

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit collapsible bowl is versatile and you can pack it on the go. Easily foldable to carry out for camping or when at home can ve used for salads or dinner. It is made of food grade silicone and is BPA free. I can use it both hot or cold items.
review.name: Foldable and versatile bowl

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very convenient and compact to use. Non-perishable plastic.Easy to clean. Super roomy. It is convenient to take with you on trips and when there are children.I recommend.
review.name: Recommend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing quality!! Easy to use, clean, and store! If you have limited space, whether in your apartment or you like to camp and hike, THIS is the company you want to go through to get your dishes and cutlery!!
review.name: Durable product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very durable bowl that can collapse into a frisbee shape for easy transport and storage. The dish is not just safe for us humans but for our best furry friends too, which gives it the opportunity for daily use as well as camping capabilities! The bowl is easy to clean, too.
review.name: Versatile bowl for many occasions

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Frontier collapsible bowl folds almost completely flat for ultimate portability and traveling. It is ultra light, BPA-free, food grade and heat resistant making it is the only travel bowl you will ever need. It is very durable and the silicone is flexible and easy to clean.
review.name: The Frontier Collasible Bowl is the ultimate travel bowl!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Durable, lightweight and perfect for camping. It’s a tad smaller than I expected but it would most certainly fulfill its purpose! I would definitely buy more for a camping trip or even to use as an extra traveling dog water bowl.
review.name: Durable and lightweight

name: Frontier UL Collapsible Bowl

description: Buy the Vasque Skywalk GTX Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Skywalk GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vasque Skywalk GTX Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I do lots of hiking. These are the first hiking boots that rubbed on my ankle bones.  I tried them for several days on the east coast trail of Newfoundland.  Too sore.  I left the hiking boots for donation when I left Newfoundland yesterday.
Not sure about the performance and quality because I only used the boots for a week.  I didn’t think that my ankle bones would ever adapt to these boots.  There is nothing unusual about my ankle bones, and they have never been sore in other boots.
review.name: Sore ankle bones
comment:
We are sorry to hear about the trouble you had with your Vasque boots. Someone from our customer service department will be reaching out to you directly to assist. 
Thank you for the review!

review.reviewBody: I received these boots as a gift from my husband & I just love them & get so many compliments when I wear them
review.name: Cute boots

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love these. I'm normally a 7-7.5 and I ordered an 8 since I'd read that they run small, but even then these were way too snug. They're narrow AND the toe box isn't high enough, which I imagine would just feel worse once you've been hiking in them for awhile. They are really gorgeous boots, though. I just wish they were available in larger and wider sizes here!
review.name: Beautiful but so narrow!
comment: Good useful comment, and thank you.

review.reviewBody: These boots are perfect for long backpacking trips or short day hikes. My feet have never been uncomfortable while wearing these, and the water proof has been solid. They have held up really well and still look new after wearing them on many adventures. The colors are awesome too!
review.name: Fit for adventure

name: Skywalk GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are OK. I really like the comfort of them, but they are so ugly. I thought they would look nicer. Anyway, they are good for the winter and quite comfortable so I will get some use out of them.
review.name: Good but ugly
comment: Hello isisbbe60, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry SLABTOWN 62'™ Men's Chelsea Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, fit is decent for a slightly wide foot.
review.name: Very pleased

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They were super comfortable. They fit really well. They have good traction and easy to go on. Feel and walk great. Great durability.  Would buy again.
review.name: Boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m a sneaker head, but every now and then Jordan’s don’t fit the occasion. These came in handy. Sneaker comfortable, not too heavy, and in my favorite color! They pair well with jeans or business casual. I really like these boots. I think I might try to grab the brown pair. Oh and they are waterproof!
review.name: Stylish, sturdy and actually sneakerhead approved

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Had to purchase a men’s shoe because they didn’t have women’s sizes big enough, so that was disappointing. But the boots were comfy and stylish!
review.name: Wish there were larger women’s sizes, but a good quality boot nonetheless.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This shoe pairs great with most of my husband's wardrobe. His only complaint it that he would need insoles to keep them comfortable. The fit is perfect, and they look great.  He won't slip in these boots, so they are great for most weather patterns.
review.name: Stylish Waterproof Boots, Must Have.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sorel is already known for their high-quality products and stylish designs and these boots are no different. Although they are men’s (they were the only shoes left in my size) I still rocked them out at a fashion show. They are like a typical Chelsea boot style but made to Sorel’s standard. They were comfortable to wear and kept my feet dry while it was raining outside. I can’t wait to wear them more.  Thanks, Inflenster! 🥾🫶🏼
review.name: These boots are the same Sorel standard we love

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow these men’s waterproof ankle boots are extremely beautiful and comfortable. My boyfriend was so excited when I gave them to him to have. These are high quality and the fit is perfect. They offer great support and because they are waterproof they’re perfect for the upcoming winter season.  My boyfriend found them so comfortable he didn’t want to take them off. They look great with jeans or khakis. I highly recommend these boots for the man in your life.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: Sorel makes great products, but I was immediately turned off by these boots. The brown "leather" upper looks shiny and plastic/vinyl-like. The do not look like they will get better with age, like good leather should. I would return them, but a friend purchased them through the factory store, so I don't want to mess with the logistics. The website description says the upper is waterproof suede. Does that mean they are real leather? Anyway, just be prepared when you open the box. The good reviews you see for these boots all come from people that received them for free.
review.name: Nicely built, but the upper looks like plastic
comment: Hello Roy, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry SLABTOWN 62'™ Men's Chelsea Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these for my husband and he says he really likes them and that they’re super comfortable. You can tell they are good quality as soon as you open the box, it even has a new leather shoe smell. They look sharp and are very functional. I feel like these will be his go to shoes when we have snow this winter.
review.name: Great boots

name: Slabtown 62 Chelsea WP Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I live in the Pacific Northwest. That means wind and rain in the 40s are common when it's not summer -  and sometimes when it is. The GORE spirit jacket is a solid piece of kit. It keeps me warm (with a sweat-soaked layer or two under it) and I have ridden in pouring rain and water did bead up on the arms and didn't seem to soak through - but it was also brand-spanking new, so we'll see if it maintains that type of weather protection or not. I wear this jacket pretty tight so I don't get wind flap. There aren't vented pits, so despite the Goretex labeling, I'm not sure that it breathes that well. I regulate the heat with the front zipper, which can tun it into a sail/balloon. As it gets colder I'll probably just be glad to be warm. Initially, I ordered a L and tried  SM and M well. I usually wear L, but went with the medium to avoid the aforementioned flappage. (40" chest, 34 waist with long arms) Time will tell how our relationship progresses, but right now it's lovely. This should probably be a $75 jacket vs. $100+. It's not actually legit Goretex, but one of their water-resistant variants, so don't expect the world. Overall, it's a nice, well made jacket that is doing the job that my legit hooded Goretex jacket does at a cheaper price-and it looks good. FOUR STARS!
review.name: At the very least, a great wind breaker.

name: Spirit Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought the Castelli Gel LF gloves a month ago.  Very high quality glove. Nicer than my Specialized gloves. Nice padding.  Just a little snug.  Hopefully will stretch out a bit.  I am 5'9" and glad I ordered an XL.
review.name: Gloves

review.reviewBody: I always wear full fingered gloves road cycling. These have been my spring-summer-early fall gloves. I love everything about them except that the stitching around both index fingers started falling apart after only a week. The padding is minimal but effective. The finger portion often needs to be slightly wet to function w/ touch with smart phones. So, with the index finger stitching falling apart, I have skin to screen contact with my phone! I'm sure that's not what Castelli intended...
review.name: Love the glove, except that it's falling

review.reviewBody:
Update: dropped 1 star because I noticed this morning that these are already coming apart. The pad on palm is coming unstitched. I have maybe half a dozen rides on these.

Even though this is a full-finger glove, it is not a cold weather glove. It is more of a thin, supple, grippy glove. 54-80F is about right. The glove stops right where the wrist starts. There is no extra material anywhere. I would use it for temps that are a bit cool and/or where I want extra grip or finger protection. The quality of the material seems good.
review.name: Supple & grippy, not cold weather glove.

name: Arenberg Gel LF Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love these glasses but they scratch too easily. I scratched mine in a fall on some rocks and I was directed to a third party to get them repaired. They don’t even sell replacement lenses for the glasses. Had I known Smith doesn’t support the product I would have made a different decision. I handled these with baby gloves but accidents happen.
review.name: Great glasses but big downside

review.reviewBody: Really brings through the PNW colors. Great fit and weight. Very happy with the Lowdown Steel.
review.name: Love that ChromaPop

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing Oakley for quite a long time. Today I swapped over to Smith and so far I'm loving these. Super light weight, great color and feel. Amazing for wearing when there's snow on the ground and it's extra bright out.
review.name: Just got these

review.reviewBody: I love these sunglasses. I got them as a prescription. They're super light weight and look great. Although the steel part of the frame is thin, you can also tell it's very sturdy. Even though they're branded as "lifestyle" sunglasses, I've worn them occasionally while rock climbing and the nosepads work great at keeping the sunglasses in place. Although these things are pretty pricey, I think they're definitely worth it!
review.name: Comfortable

name: Lowdown Steel ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
Comfortable, with very little break-in needed. Good fit, true-to-size (for me). Very good traction in a variety of terrains, good all-around Vibram tread pattern. Performed much better for me than I've seen reviewed elsewhere (i.e. no problems on icy gravel or wet slick rock, compared with other trail runners or hiking shoes). Plenty durable for the kinds and lengths of trails I hike. Previous versions have lasted me 1-2 years of regular use and abuse.

-1 star for being somewhat more water resistant than "waterproof". If you're hiking through wet grass long enough, water will eventually soak through.

-1 star for lack of ventilation. They are stuffy! This is the only version of the Moabs I've  worn that make my feet sweat to the point of being uncomfortable and blister prone. On cold outings they're fine, but be advised: wear them all day and your feet will end up soggy and gross from the inside.
review.name: Great...but Stuffy!

review.reviewBody:
First pair I received in the mail were defective. The left shoe made a popping sound each step out of the box. The ~2 week exchange process was easy enough. 

The second pair actually was a better color than the first and they didn’t have any defects to them. Had the first pair been defect-free like these, I would have given a 5* review.
review.name: Second try was the charm
comment: Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I work in a job that requires sturdy, comfortable shoes. My girlfriend purchased me this pair as a gift and I love them!
review.name: Great shoes. Very comfortable and sturdy.
comment: Thank you!

review.reviewBody: A great shoe.  These are comfortable and they last a very long time.
review.name: Great shoe
comment: Thank you for the great feedback, Larry!

review.reviewBody: These are the only hiking shoes/boots I have ever had that were fully comfortable the minute I put them on and did not need to be broken in. I've now worn them for almost a month and they remain the best pair I have ever had.
review.name: Didn't need to be broken in
comment: We love to hear that! Thank you!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable hiker. I wear them as a work shoe around the yard, and at volunteer yard maintenance projects. No foot fatigue at all
review.name: Hiker/work shoe
comment: Thank you for sharing your experience with us!

review.reviewBody: They are awesome!  The break in time is nothing.  They are very comfortable.
review.name: Comfort and Protection

review.reviewBody: Comfort from the start!  No breaking in needed. (all though I did wear on walks at home before our trip to Utah).  8 days of hiking Utah’s 5 National parks!  No foot pain at all!
review.name: Hiking Utah’s mighty 5 national Parks!

review.reviewBody: Best shoes I have ever put on my feet.  Great for walking.  Great in cold weather.  Great in summer, too!
review.name: Outstanding

review.reviewBody: It is ridiculous that one should have to buy shoes "a half size bigger"  than labeled and then you don't sell a 13.5.  Fix the sizing, real simple. The new shoes are indeed tight and this may end up being my last pair though I have worn your brand for maybe as long as 15 years.
review.name: Inaccurate sizing of footwear

name: Moab 3 Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have a very good experience! I like the shoes' quality!
review.name: Excellent!

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have owned multiple pairs of Salmon's over the years. We have hiked many miles together!  I have noticed in this current pair and the previous pair that there is little padding/support on the balls of my feet, which is unfortunate because I love everything else about them.  I can't take them on long hikes because the ball of my feet become sore.
review.name: Loveee these shoes
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoe in terms of trail running traction and being waterproof is really good. However, the fit and sizing is disappointing. My small toes on both feet are getting blisters / chafing. I suspect this is the large size of the toe cap and the shoe being too big. I used the size guidance provided but I should have trusted my instinct and gone half a size smaller. I have been trail running for over 10 years and have never had this problem before, but this is also my first time trying a Salomon trail running shoe. It's disappointing as over and above this the rubber on the front their walking shoe I bought earlier in the year started to peel off from the shoe. Not a great first experience with Salomon so far.
review.name: Good but blisters / chafing on small toes

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic shoe helped sort my arches after being ruined by wearing Dr Martin boots 😳
review.name: Love them !

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this last month and am very pleased with the fit. I love the look.
review.name: Love the shoe

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore these hiking in rain in Glacier. My feet were soaked. There must have been 2 Tbsp of water sloshing around my feet. I have been wearing xa pro for years and have many pairs. But the waterproof ones are not waterproof.
review.name: Not waterproof!
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought a month ago, great for walking/ gym classes/trail running and look good too.
review.name: Perfect!

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Four years ago I purchased a pair of Salomon Gore-tex trail hikers, when I had my right hip replace. I wanted shoes I could slip on and off. I LOVED my old shoes and wore them so much that they were finally starting to wear out. Salomon wasn't making them anymore, so I took a chance on the XA PRO 3D V9 GORE-TEX. I LOVE them. I had my left hip replaced June 19, so I was hoping for the same convenience as the old shoes. These are great and I like them better overall than my older ones.
review.name: Great Replacement for my old Salomon's

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This hiking shoe has a very stiff heel box that works well for me.  I have foot issues and the solidness of the heel box in this particular shoe allows me to have a more natural gait.  This is my 4th pair.
review.name: Heel box

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair of this style Salomon. I find them really comfortable to walk and run in. I would say that I made the mistake of taking them for a 5k without wearing them in and got blistered but that was my mistake.
review.name: Great shoe

name: XA Pro 3D V9 GORE-TEX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these.  For 32 bucks the cotton is just not a soft hand feel as mentioned in one of the comments and the cut is a little boxy and the sleeves are short. Definitely not an athletic fit. kI kinda look like a freak in these. Wish I would've not ripped the tags off but was thinking they're just t shirts, how bad could it be?

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic t-shirt. Great fit and hand feel. I have washed this multiple times and it has held up.

review.reviewBody: I picked up this classic goat tee in size large. The soft cotton tee is fantastic and holds it's form great even after multiple washes. The subtle distressed branding also looks great without being in your face.
review.name: Classic

review.reviewBody: I purchased both a White and Heavy Metal in size Small, which is my normal size.  The size of the same two shirts (of different colors) was not the same.  The white one fit fine, but the Heavy Metal was tight on the arms.  Also to note, the length is slightly longer on these than other size small shirts from other brands usually are.  I'm a fan of the design on the gray one.  Unfortunately, that's the one that didn't fit well.
review.name: Sizing is not consistent

review.reviewBody: For me the lens does not provide satisfactory eye protection from the sun.
review.name: For me the lens does

review.reviewBody: Not as photochromatic as my red photo lens but still great for carried conditions. It is more blue in color and I wish you couldn’t see your eyes. But other than that it’s all you need. I wear clear on pow days but this is killer 90% of days on the east coast.
review.name: Great everyday lens

review.reviewBody:
After scratching the original Red Mirror that came with my goggles in a crash I bought the replacement lenses in Red Mirror and Black. Both yield similar results but I think the Red allows me to see the contours in the snow slightly better. I use the red on cold days as they make everything look slightly blue, adding to the ambiance of cold winter days in "the White Room". Surveying the scene through the Red Mirror from the precipice of a Black Diamond sets a mood like I'm a big-mountain adventurer even though I shouldn't be allowed on anything beyond the bunny slope. They perfectly and reliably protect my eyes as my confidence becomes horror as I clip the first tree I pass and go spinning out of control. Perhaps Smith could make a model that's super-dark towards the top so I can't see people shaking their heads at me from the lift. The black seems to make things look slightly warmer and they add to the mood on warmer late-season days. 

All kidding aside, excellent lenses. Pleased with my purchase and would buy again.
review.name: Setting the Mood with Colors

review.reviewBody: One of my lens came with the goggles fogged like crazy.
review.name: Fogged like crazy

review.reviewBody: As the other reviewer mentioned, the storm yellow lenses are likely the best low light lenses I've ever tried. Although for those on a budget, or do not care for ChromaPop, the clear lens is the way to go. Still gives you great vision on those epic storm days.
review.name: Don't Overlook Clear Lenses!

hasVariant.name: TELOS TR2 PLUS Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit TELOS TR2 PLUS Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] its a great tent but it just barely fits too standard sleeping pads inside. Also compared to other two man tents it can take a while to set up.
review.name: Strong, but small and hard to set up

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the packing system; it is easy to share with someone or only bring the necessary. The tent has Excellent Ventilation and is lightweight. So far, it seems great quality, but I haven't been through a giant storm yet. It's spacious for a two-person tent and very warm.
review.name: Spacious, warm and great ventilation

review.reviewBody:
I had the opportunity to use the Telos Plus Freestanding Ultralight Tent over President's Weekend in Colorado at an elevation of 12,000 feet with plenty of snow. It even snowed about 3 inches during the trip. On the positive side, the tent's lightweight design impressed me, as did the innovative multiple-stuff sacks, making it highly portable and organized. Its ease of setup was notable, and it successfully kept me dry inside with almost no condensation, a commendable feat under the snowy conditions.

However, my experience wasn't without its drawbacks. Disappointingly, during my first use, I discovered a hole in the tent's floor. Given that I was on snow, I don't believe I caused the cut. This issue likely points to the material's extreme thinness, which, while understandable in the pursuit of minimizing weight, should not come at the expense of basic durability, such as maintaining an intact tent floor. Having lived in Colorado and Utah my entire life, engaging in activities like hunting and mountaineering across all seasons, this is the first time I've encountered a tent floor cutting open. This incident marks a significant concern regarding the material's durability and the tent's overall reliability in rugged conditions.
review.name: Telos Plus Tent Review: Lightweight with a Flaw

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Material, Quality, Craftsmanship, Service was Awesome!! Easy to setup as a first time backpacker 25 minutes total setup time.
review.name: Awesome Product!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Spacious not to heavy warm in cold weather would not use it for summer great winter tent easy set up
review.name: Spacious not to heavy warm

review.reviewBody:
I brought the Telos Tr2 Plus along with me for the past month on an unsupported bicycle tour from Colorado to Mississippi. I slept in the tent 24 of the 29 days I was on the road. This was my first time using it so I had my reservations taking an unknown tent with me but as a fan of Sea to Summit and the gear they make, I had the utmost faith.
I had nights that ranged from 17F up to 65F, I always felt that the tent stayed as warm as could be expected. I really liked having the fabric walls on the inner tent in place of the mesh. It offered a bit more privacy on those nights when the tent fly was not needed. I was a bit nervous that the small vents at the top of the tent would not be sufficient but they seemed to do the trick. The only times I had issue with condensation was through Louisiana, I'm not sure there is a tent in the world that can handle that level of condensation. I highly recommend the gear loft as well, it gets your clothes for the next day up off the ground and gives them a chance to breath a little bit better. Inside the tent, spacious! I had enough room to spread out and get comfortable all while storing all of my panniers inside the tent. I found myself not using the lightbar feature however I can certainly see how useful this could be, especially if you are staying in one place for more than 1 night. It is a bit difficult to pull the tent tight for the tension ridge but once you do it a few times you get used to it and appreciate the fact that the tent doesn't flap around at all. I used the smaller ground tarp with the tent as I find myself setting it up without a rainfly as much as I can, if you pack the tent as tight as you can the inner tent and the ground fly can be packed together, eliminating the need for te seperate ground tarp bag. All in all the only issues that I encountered was the color (the tent is not as discretely colored as I would like), and the tent stakes seemed to bend rather easily. I'm still quite impressed with this tent. From cold weather to hot and humid weather, it preformed wonderfully. It is light, durable, and well designed. It provides ample protection from the elements and I am so looking forward to taking it out into the backcountry this winter to test it even more! The Telos TR2 Plus will be my go to tent from now on, another S2S product knocking it out of the park!
review.name: 29 Days from Colorado to Mississippi

review.reviewBody: Our new Telos 2+ tent was fresh out of the box when we put it up to the cold, wet weather test for 10 days in the high country of the Eagle Cap Wilderness. The ventilation system is well designed leaving no condensation on the inside walls of the tent. Thus, our sleeping bags stayed dry while we huddled in the spacious tent for 2.5 days of blowing snow. The fabric walls instead of mosquito netting was an appreciated choice too. The easy tensioning of the rainfly corners to the tent kept the tent taught beneath any snow load too. 4 stars because: 1. Attaching the rainfly to the tent poles didn't go smoothly if the tent poles were already attached to the tent groundsheet rubber grommets. The groundsheets rubber grommets prevented the latching on of the rainfly easily; 2. The tension bar that spans the tent rainfly is extremely tight. One is hesitant to pull, and pull and stretch a brand new rainfly as one doesn't know the strength of the material/fabric. I was sure I would rip the rainfly in half on my first...and subsequent...use. I added either rubber bands or an elastic loop to attach the rainfly to the tiny, tight little hooks but pulling and pulling the rainfly fabric doesn't seem to me to be a good thing for the long run; 3. Matching the shape of the groundsheet (the one that has material that extends out to cover the vestibules) to the shape of the tent to lay out was always an added puzzle even after 12 days of use; 3. The gray tent poles and blue tent poles could have been better color distinguished...the blue is too close in tone to the gray...yet another second or two of delay due to head scratching. How about a yellow or red color?; 4. The tent zipper pulls could be a bit heftier. I know you are trying to save weight everywhere possible but we are going to add some bigger cord to grab onto a 3pm; 5. Didn't find converting the tent storage bags into a light bar or extra storage necessary; 5. Due to the blowing snow we did feel the need to zip close the outer vent as moisture threatened to come in onto the netting of the vent below; 6. The ground sheet tore after the 4th day of use. Not sure what caused it...but I have used ground cloths on my former tent for years without a tear. So that was a surprise. 7. Just our situation perhaps. But our 2 Thermarest Neo(?) mattresses were a bit wide for the tent side by side. But the length was fine. So for us a couple of more inches in width would have been nice. All n' all we like the tent. It kept us both warm and dry in cold, wet conditions over a few days so that is it's strong suit. The rainfly goes way down to the ground and is easy to keep tight. Good quality materials and construction. Yes, it is a bit easier to get in and out then our former double vestibule tent. The only 4 stars is due to the little nitpicky annoyances mostly with setting up the tent.
review.name: From out of the box to into the snow

name: TELOS TR2 PLUS Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody:
Loved the look of these boots but need to return for a size up.
Also, the boots were on sale for Black Friday, but the exchange will be Full price!   Not paying that!
Returning today, no reordering.
review.name: Good Looking Boot
comment: Hello Lake Lady, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Plus Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for an upcoming holiday to Switzerland and wanted boots that were warm and waterproof but also stylish and these tick all the boxes.
review.name: Perfect Winter Boots

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Plus Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: What a HORRIBLE company!!!!  How can you offer a customer a shoe - by offering a Black Friday sale - and because I need a different size CHARGE ME THE FULL PRICE FOR THE EXCHANGED/NEW SHOE? What a complete disappointment and RIP OFF. Even worse, you put your CSAgents in an awful situation by making them tell the customer, we cannot "make a price adjustment". Of course YOU CAN.  You just choose to rip customers off.  Will return this shoe and NEVER PURCHASE FROM YOU AGAIN. BUYER BEWARE!!
review.name: HORRIBLE COMPANY
comment: Hello Mac, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Plus Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are my favorite shoes of all time. They’re so warm I only wear thin socks with them. They’re more comfortable than tennis shoes with a really great supportive squishy sole. I wear them all winter long in Pittsburgh. I think of them as a great commuter shoe, you can walk in them all day and they’ll keep out the inclement weather. They got me through a whole winter and held up great. I was honesty shocked to see they only have a 3.9 out of 5, I can’t recommend these boots enough!
review.name: Best boot of all time

review.itemreviewed: Whitney II Plus Lace WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Needed some new 'in between' boots for winter and these are perfect! They offer just the right amount of warmth & comfort for travel/boots to wear to work & more! I'd recommend sizing up just a 0.5 size if you're someone that likes wearing thicker socks though, the lining in them is fairly thick & doesn't have a ton of wiggle room.
review.name: Love them already!

review.reviewBody:
Loved the fit (taper near waist) while staying puffy and warm enough for daily use in moderately cold weather (haven’t tested it in colder weather yet)

review.reviewBody: Excellent jacket, warm, light weight and good length of sleeves.
review.name: Excellent jacket, warm, light weight

review.reviewBody: Excellent, lovely and warm with nice long sleeves.
review.name: Excellent, lovely and warm with

review.reviewBody: I ordered a 14 the coat was nice but too big, so I ordered a 12, this was exactly the same size when carefully compared, (the labels all said 12), so I had to return both. I fully understand about layers of clothing underneath and about size tolerances, but I assessed this parka should be reasonably snug, otherwise the cold air just wafts in and out of the coat as you move. Now I have ordered a size 10 - I'm worried it will be too small!! The sleeve length was good, and the fabric was nice. So this project is ongoing!
review.name: I ordered a 14 the

review.reviewBody: Love it, but disappointed that it doesn’t have an inside pocket; the image on the website is misleading because it looks as though there is one!
review.name: Love it, but disappointed that

review.reviewBody: Lovely warm and very comfortable coat. Great for winter walks in the hills or just out walking the dog. Extremely pleased, love the deep heather colour and looks great with Oxblood Red Essential Beanie.
review.name: Warm comfortable stretchy down coat :-)

review.reviewBody:
I really like the coat it fits well and is warm.
My only complaint is that it doesn't have a secure zipped pocket on the inside. My other jacket does and it's handy for keys etc. If I put my keys in the hand pockets I worry that I will loose them by accident.
review.name: I really like the coat

review.reviewBody: This is classy jacket! I love the way it looks and feels. It's my go-to jacket for any casual or fancy outing. My favorite part of this jacket is the stretch! It moves with you, making it more comfortable than any of my other down jacket I own. The weave technology on this jacket allows the baffles to be woven from a single fabric, which means no stitching is needed. Because of this, it retains your body warmth even more. It feels less bulky than a traditional down jacket. Most down parkas look the same but this Rab jacket has it's own unique stylish look that I absolutely love!!
review.name: Classy, Unique & Warm!

review.reviewBody: Lovely and warm. Only downside is I had to get a bigger size than I needed to have the length in the arms
review.name: Lovely and warm. Only downside

review.reviewBody: I haven't worn this yet so my rating can't be taken as final. It looks and fits OK but I'm really hoping it will keep me warm when I go on holiday to Norway in 2022!
review.name: I haven't worn this yet

review.reviewBody:
This is my second season with these Snowcrew pants.  They are extremely comfortable, have been completely waterproof even in rain and heavy wet/warm snow.  I also bought the Snowcrew jacket and it has performed just as well.  

A few weeks ago we had some bad ice on the mountain after an inversion layer warmed things up for a few days, I ended up falling on the ice and slid 26.7 mph (thanks GPS) about 200 yards down rough ice.  I felt heat coming through my to my hip, upper arm, and shoulder and thought I had shedded my pants and jacket, and thought my skin was next.   To my amazement, both my pants and jacket don’t have a mark on them.  I couldn’t believe it.  

People were walking around the lodge that day with torn pants and jackets from other reputable, more expensive manufacturers.  I am an OR customer for life now.
review.name: Comfortable, Dry, and Durable

review.reviewBody: Fit well, lightly insulated, comfortable on a 14F degree day (4F at the summit) with light baselayer.

Went skiing and my legs stayed warm and dry. Breathe well and shed snow. Good features in the pockets and cuffs, well laid out. They fit pretty baggy, more of a snowboarder style. I liked them well enough that after I got back from skiing I bought the snowcrew jacket. They are lighter than I expected so I didn't think they'd be so warm, I guess modern synthetic insulation has gotten pretty good.
review.name: Warm and Dry

review.reviewBody: The pants are fine. Could use a back pocket and a more stout fabric. I purchased in a copper color which I like and is quite nice. Not warm enough for a really cold day (anything below about 10 degrees) but they are roomy enough for a thick base layer.
review.name: OK Ski Pant

review.reviewBody: I have not worn as they are too big - I should have ordered a medium. I will return. Dick
review.name: Probably would not order again

review.reviewBody: Actually pretty warm for how thin they are, You can layer underneath they fit well around the waist and they're nice and waterproof
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: I'm very happy with these pants so far. The waterproofing seems to be great. The vents are long and work well. They are comfortable. Warm, but not too warm. Overall, these are great. I do wish there were more pocket options. I don't understand why these wouldn't have rear pockets, or at least something in addition to the normal front-thigh pocket. But that is my only criticism. My jacket has enough pockets to make up for it.
review.name: Very happy with these pants

review.reviewBody: Wore them on a windy Winnipeg day with wind chill at -25. Can't go much more than -15 without another form of insulation underneath them, but for anything above this temperature they are a solid light weight waterproof and mostly wind proof pant!
review.name: Good light insulated pants

review.reviewBody: Warm pants in 32F PNW weather. Fit as expected; not too baggy but enough not to be constricting. Only a couple of small pockets though. Cranberry is more red than orange. Powerstrap pass uthrough is a great idea.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: Have already gotten so much use out of these pants! Fantastic for skiing and fit great
review.name: Fantastic Pants

name: Snowcrew Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Big Water V Personal Flotation Device
review.reviewBody:
I'm very impressed with this company! (First-time buyer.)
  This NRS Class V White water life jacket arrived less than 48 hours after I ordered it, and the shipping was FREE!!  
  The price was phenomenal, the best I've seen on this model. 
  Communication was fantastic!  I received several emails updating me on the progress of my order - from it being packed and shipped to it's arrival.
  I've been a private white water rafter for nearly 30 years and have owned tons of equipment and many brands and styles of life jackets. My friends and I constantly compare our things. We're not "gearheads" but do strive to get the best of best when it comes to our safety.  This jacket definitely fits that bill.  
  I highly recommend Backcountry.com and this NRS life preserver!    
   Fit-wise, this jacket is very adjustable.  After reading another review I thought I should add that I'm a 5'11" male with a slim-medium build and typically wear size Large shirts.  The jacket would easily size down to at least a mid-small person, and up to at least XL - it says 30" to 52" chest. (NRS makes a Plus-size jacket for bigger people).
  One thing I'll need to get used to is the padding/flotation material on the chest - it's 2.75" thick.  It's well shaped and does not interfere with my ability to row, but it is thicker than I'm used to.  But hey, I want that much floatation in a vest and since it has to go somewhere the chest is where I want it.  The back padding/flotation material is only about .75" thick (as is the head flap) so it's easy to lean against gear or sit in a chair.
review.name: Exceptional product, delivery & price!!!

review.itemreviewed: Big Water V Personal Flotation Device
review.reviewBody:
This jack will float most every adult, it's extremely well made, offers a customizing fit and is perfect for high back chairs on a sit on top kayak.  I didnt like the yellow color because it was more of a bright mustard color even though yellow is better for visual response, I purchased the orange and it it a bright but pleasing color.  I can't say enough good things about this vest!
I am 5'7 165 lbs. and female  The jacket is tall/long so if you are very short and thin you may want to try on the child's size but make sure you fall within the weight limits. I did purchase the optional leg straps for rough water use, this is the best jacket I have owned and as a very active 63 year old I have owned many in my lifetime. Mine is the universal fit but they make one that I think goes up to 58" for the bigger framed folks.
review.name: 25lbs of float, my life will be saved!

name: Big Water V Personal Flotation Device

review.reviewBody: Incredibly lightweight. Water resistant. Love the loose fit and ability to cinch at the base. Waist tie also helps keep pants secure moving. I wear these a lot - to and from trail runs, dog walks and grocery gets.
review.name: Super lightweight wear them all the time

review.reviewBody:
Bought size L and they seemed to be too short (like a regular length 32" inseam); too large in the waist; waistband system seemed overly complicated and ineffective (not enough elastic so when cinched down it looks frumpy).

Materials and construction were great. Ankle cinches seemed fine.

Would have kept if they fit; I just wish the size chart was more accurate, especially considering that this is an in-house brand.
review.name: Cool but did not fit me

review.reviewBody: Used numerous times backpacking in hot breezy conditions. Extremely comfortable, very lightweight. Baggy around the ankles. Has an elastic drawstring to cinch around the ankles but still too loose and you have a dangling loop of elastic that catches on everything on the trail.
review.name: Very lightweight, cool and baggy

review.reviewBody: these pants are extremely lightweight and perfect for anything. I have taken them hiking, paddleboarding, boating and use them often when I have to fly.  They are great travel pants.  One thing that can appear to be a defect but is not, is the bungee cord at the ankle, the joint part can become exposed if you pull the cord to turn the pant into a cinched ankle, but I just put that part back into the tunnel and it all works well. The wind protection on them is superior (bc its Pertex Quantum Air fabric) so you can take these anywhere in almost any season.
review.name: Buying my third pair now

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I'm a former marathoner that loves running.  For the sake of my knees, I only run trails now--no pavement.  These are the BEST trail runners!  I also use them a lot while doing photography for my job in the backcountry if I'm not mountain-climbing. I've just bought my third pair!!!  My first pair still looks great, but I put a LOT of miles on my running shoes, so over time, the cushioning wears out.  Then they are great for hiking, walking, etc., but not for running if you have sensitive knees.  My friends clamor for my old ones bc they still look so good and make great walking and hiking shoes.

Pros:
*Great arch support
*AH MAZ ING all-round cushioning to save my ankles and knees.  In fact, it's this aspect that tells me when it's time to buy a new pair bc my knees start to complain around the 500 mile mark.
*PHENOMENAL grip...I can stand on a giant 45 degree angle boulder that's wet, wearing a 30 lb pack, and these shoes hold me steady while I'm photographing 
*Really nice drop for maximum comfort and performance running
*The different lacing options at the ankle ensure a perfect and comfortable fit for your foot
*Roomy toebox
*Water repellant (as long as the snow doesn't go over the tops of the shoes :-))
*I've washed mine (line dry afterwards) and they clean up really well--just remove the Ortholite pad first
*The tread design naturally releases mud and stuff, so you don't have to worry about cleaning off the bottoms after a particularly wild run
*They hold up superbly, so even after 500 miles, they are still great for hiking, walking, etc.  

Cons: Are they being discontinued?  Ohhhhh the humanity!!! 

Note:  I normally wear a 7-7.5 in dress shoes, sandals and such, but I size up in my running and hiking footwear bc feet (and muscles) swell as you work.  So the 39.5 is perfect for me.  I have a very high arch, and a foot that narrows in the middle a lot, but is normal width at the heel and front--so it's kind of hourglass shaped.  I love that this shoe has a wide enough toe box for me, yet still narrows enough in the middle to conform to my foot.  That's hard to find.  If you have really narrow feet all over, especially at the toes, then this shoe probably wouldn't be the best choice for you.  

Final note, these are EXTREMELY grippy. Most shoes you can turn your body and knees, and your shoes/feet will follow.  These will NOT! They are made to grip in all terrain, and not let go.
review.name: Best Trail-Running Shoes EVEEEEERRRR!

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these based on a number of “best of” and “editors’ pick” reviews. Was drawn to touted stability and sensitivity. Oh well, they are neither stable nor responsive and do not fit to size, running a half size too large - at least for me. My feet are sliding in them. The soles do seem grippy - would be if they fit better. I gave three stars because they do seem well made but I would only try on at a shop, not chance online purchase.  I’ve worn them four times on a medium to rugged trail.
review.name: Maybe the right shoe for someone else

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of this style. Good fit, support, comfort. I have narrow feet. Street shoe is 8 1/2 narrow. I own another pair of this same shoe and when these went on sale I decided to purchase a second pair. I upped my size from 41 to 41.5 and find that is better fit. Though a little wider as a result, the extra toe length is better for me. I have tried on multiple La Sportiva running shoes styles, for my foot this fits me the best. My needs: slight pronation, narrow, "normal" foot with slightly arch. I use one pair for work (I stand all day) one pair for the road.
review.name: My go to trail shoe

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Ultra Raptor II.  This shoe is like putting your foot in the finest and best fitting "glove" you will ever find.  I frequently forget that I have it on.  I am 80 years old and I walk 2 miles a day.  This is what I wear every time I leave the house.
review.name: Best Walking Shoe Ever

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have bunions and flat feet which makes it hard to buy shoes. In the ultra raptors, I have finally found a shoe that takes care of both.
review.name: Great shoe for support and wide fore foo

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these first in the black men’s gortex for work-I am a mail carrier. My feet have not yet been wet. So comfortable.   I came back and bought another pair for hiking non gortex and LOVE THEM. They are a little narrow which for me is perfect as I have a long narrow foot.  The rubber grippy on the bottom wears a little on pavement (my gortex ones) but have not had any issues with my blue trail pair.
review.name: Best shoe

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Wow. This is a beautiful shoe in Ink/Topaz and the quality of construction is impressive. I am a US size 8 in all my hiking/running shoes and the 39.5 fit perfectly.  Except.  When I ordered another pair as backup the toe box was so narrow it hurt went I tried it on!  Too tight to even contemplate trying to stretch them out.  Don't know if that was a one off defect or maybe the pair that fit were just made a bit wider in the toe box.  
 I also bought the same shoe in the GTX model and it had the same fit defect, too narrow in the toe box.  I have average feet, not wide, and high arches. On the positive side, the pair that fit have good arch/heel support, amazing stability, flexibility, and COMFORT!  Would have happily kept all 3 if not for the narrow fit problem.  May try to find them again in a store so I can check the fit first.  Otherwise, great trail shoes for a more narrow foot.
review.name: Runs narrow in toe box

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Lightweight, Comfortable, Wide toe box, No break in necessary, Good gripping sole, Fantastic color, Need to upsize
review.name: Ultra Raptor II Trail Runner

name: Ultra Raptor II Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Would be much better with a front fly (that would benefit both men and women...) rather than the extra weight and material of useless pockets....  We already have pockets on the pants we are wearing underneath and if you do put anything in these rain pants pockets, it just makes them slip down off your waist....
review.name: Needs a front fly.... Pockets are useless....

review.reviewBody:
Great fit. Simple to put on without taking off your boots, even with heavy duty boots like mine (don’t try and put boots through cuff with zippers all the way down, easy to bring zippers up to create wider openings for big boots).
Nice to have pockets as well. Convenient and comfortable all around.
review.name: Great fit, comfortable, convenient zippers

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great rain protection pants. I love the way they zip completely on both sides. That makes it very convenient to pull them off and on.
review.name: Great rain p Whants

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The full-zip feature of these pants is a game-changer. Putting them on while wearing heavy boots has never been easier. The convenience of being able to zip them up quickly without needing to remove my footwear is a huge plus. It saves me time and effort, allowing me to focus on the adventure at hand.

One of the standout features of these pants is their lightweight nature. They are incredibly easy to pack and carry, making them a perfect choice for my backcountry backpacking trips. The last thing I want is bulky and heavy gear weighing me down, and these pants excel in this aspect. Despite being lightweight, they don't compromise on durability. The Marmot NanoPro™ recycled nylon face fabric is not only eco-friendly but also incredibly sturdy and long-lasting.

When it comes to protection against the elements, the PreCip Eco Full-Zip Pants deliver. The waterproof and breathable properties are outstanding. I have worn them during heavy downpours, and they have kept me dry throughout. The fully taped seams prevent any leaks, ensuring that I stay comfortable even in stormy weather. The bonded storm flaps over the zippers are an excellent addition, effectively keeping moisture out and enhancing the overall waterproofing.

The zippered hand pockets and back pocket offer convenient storage options for small essentials. It's reassuring to know that I can keep my belongings secure and easily accessible while on the move. Additionally, the elastic waist provides a snug and comfortable fit, allowing for unrestricted movement.

The Men's PreCip Eco Full-Zip Pants are a reliable companion for any outdoor adventure. They excel in terms of convenience, lightweight design, and superior protection against the elements. Whether you're planning a trek in stormy weather or need a just-in-case piece in your backpack, these pants are up to the task. I highly recommend them for their exceptional quality and performance.
review.name: A Reliable Companion for Outdoor Adventures

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light, full zip, and great fit.  I will keep these in my backpack for when the snow falls in the backcountry.
review.name: Awesome Full-Zip Pants for Winter Weather

review.reviewBody: Material is good, light weight, however there is no belt loop, only elastic band, therefore feels unsecure.
review.name: Good product but with flaw

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Well made, waterproof, easy to vent and easy on and off.
review.name: Solid purchase

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I don’t use rain pants often, but I’m occasionally really happy to have them. These are lightweight, but the full length zippers do add some bulk. Full zip is a rare feature in this price range and was the main reason I got them. They’re easy to get on and off, even with boots and crampons, although I would practice a couple times before you actually get caught in a storm.

I’m sort of between sizes in regards to length, I think I would choose the shorter one next time. But I’m not wearing these for style so it’s also not a big deal if they bunch up a bit near my boot.
review.name: Excellent!

review.reviewBody: Really wanted to like these. I have an older pair with partial leg zips and a drawstring. Loved the full-zip putting them on and could navigate the lack of drawstring by tightening the velcro a bit, but they are super long. I'm 5' 9" w/ a 30" inseam, and the size large extended inches past my boot soles. I measured about them at about 33".
review.name: Great Pants But Waaay Too Long

Lacking cancerous DWR coatings, is this the best that can be done for breathable waterproof - total wet out followed by actual wet?
review.name: Waterproof? Then Why Am I wet?

review.itemreviewed: Cedars Merino Lightweight Crew Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this shirt because I really liked the 2023 version (the Spruce line).  Both the light weight and mid-weight Spruce line were very nice and are among my favorite base layers among the different brands I have.  I would have bought another one of those last year, but they sold out,   Unfortunately the 2024 version (Cedars) is very different.  It is more tight fitting but tends to ride up with much movement, and has a very annoying tag (which can be clipped off).  The various color options this year also leave a lot to be desired.  The price point for this shirt, when on sale, is good, and is the reason I did not just return it.  The addition of the thumb holes are a nice detail, although are not useful for me.  Even after having worn it 20+ times since purchasing it, I still find it annoying every time, which is what prompted this review.  Would like to see the Spruce line come back in solid colors suitable for casual wear but could also work under business attire for those cold winter office environments and long walking commutes.  I am generally a fan of BackCountry, but this product was disappointing.
review.name: '24 Cedars not as good as '23 Spruces

name: Cedars Merino Lightweight Crew Baselayer Top - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Abrazo Hooded Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: It's a versatile fleece and a great color. I can layer it and then it fits well. Sleeves are a tad bit long though. But I love it anyhow. Highly recommended.

review.itemreviewed: Abrazo Hooded Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I received the Abrazo as a replacement for another hoodie I purchased that was damaged and out of stock. It’s slightly different with a light scuba fabric over the hood and shoulders. I actually love it because I often run out with my fleece in the rain to walk a dog really quick. This feels like it will just wip right off! So happy. I would highly recommend.
review.name: So Happy!!

review.itemreviewed: Abrazo Hooded Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the fit of this jacket and I love the color. Only thing I wish that was different is for the pockets to be zipper pockets. I would recommend this jacket because it is great for Fall weather and for hiking.

review.itemreviewed: Abrazo Hooded Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this jacket and the colors are fun. It is warm but not bulky and is perfect for the Fall evenings where I live.
review.name: Soft, warm and so cute.

review.itemreviewed: Abrazo Hooded Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Was on sale; bought one for myself and another for my sister so we can have "sister jackets!" Fit is true to size; room for long sleeves without being bulky. Nice pockets and then zipper chest pocket for phone when hiking. I think this will be a great jacket for years to come. My sister loved hers too!

review.itemreviewed: Abrazo Hooded Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love my jacket. I’m very sad because the jacket end up falling from my back back when I went back camping :(

review.itemreviewed: Abrazo Hooded Full-Zip Fleece Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I already know this fleece will be a favorite come the fall. It's not heavy, so it will be just right inside or outside once the weather is cooler. After reading reviews and measuring carefully with the Cotopaxi size guide, I decided to go up one size from my usual L because I didn't want a close fit. And it's perfect—roomy enough to wear a sweater underneath, and not clingy at all.
review.name: Sizing up gave just the right fit

review.reviewBody: Great seat. No pressure to my nether regions and I have my seat and handlebars no set where my hands don’t get numb!  But try several seats. Your body will tell you which one is correct. For me, it is the Nymber.
review.name: Fantastic seat- for my body

review.reviewBody: I've wanted to try an SMP saddle on my road bike for a while now. After finding out I could test multiple saddles at the same time, I was ready to give them a try. Gianluca helped me figure out which nose tilt position would work for me and narrowed down my saddle choices a bit. I got 4 saddles sent to me and took a long ride with each. I set them to the same saddle height and adjusted the fore/aft and nose tilt throughout the ride. I kept one and swapped 3 for a different 3. I narrowed it down to 3 saddles and did a final ride swapping the saddles every couple miles. Although I'm fairly small, the evolution was a little too narrow and caused hot spots on my sit bones after a handful of miles. I ended up getting the Nymber, as even after my 20 miles of testing it was still comfortable with only thin chamois bibs.
review.name: Looking forward to next season

name: Nymber Saddle

review.reviewBody: Nice Hoodie!
review.name: Hoodie

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’11” and 165lbs and I feel like it’s just a tad too big. But it is very comfortable and very well made. It will last for years. Hoping it shrinks a bit in the dryer but even if it doesn’t I’ll use it as a top layer.
review.name: Just a tad to big but too comfy

review.reviewBody:
It's good. Exactly what I'd expect for $89, no more, no less. The fit is perfect, the material is decently thick. It's not the softest, but it's warm, and feels durable. 

Yeah, you can probably find something better for the price, but with Patagonia, you pay little extra for their impressive ethics and environmental consciousness. I'm not factoring that part into my rating though. As far as the actual product goes, It's on par with the quality I'm used to from them: Just about right for what you're paying. If this goes on sale for under $75, that's when I'd say it's a great deal.
review.name: Exactly your money's worth

name: Roy Icon Uprisal Hoodie

review.reviewBody: Love this split board! It handles everything from deep pow, corn, to chunder well. The shape and hardware layout make the uphill a breeze. The skin system makes the transitions quick and efficient. Overall this splitboard is super fun and makes backcountry travel enjoyable for riders of all levels.
review.name: Weston Backwoods Carbon Split

review.reviewBody: This is my go-to board for longer/bigger missions and i've used it in a wide variety of terrain and conditions all around Colorado and it has been an amazing board. I love the shape and feel of the board from powder to steep couloirs. And a plus it helps with a little weight savings especially on bigger missions.
review.name: 5 Star!

review.reviewBody: Not going to lie, the first time I held the backwoods carbon I was skeptical. How could a splitboard this light hold up to the test? Well, after a few years of putting it up against just about everything you can think of, I can confidently say that they did not compromise strength at all with the carbon construction. Big days on traverses such as the Bugaboos to Rogers Pass I was grateful for the weight savings. the backwoods carbon split also pairs beautifully with a hard boot setup!  From coast to coast bottomless pow to the most heinous of ice and rock I felt confident with this bad boy under my feet.
review.name: shocking!

review.reviewBody: I have been riding this board for a couple years now and just keep coming back for more!  This has been my daily driver for riding mid winter in the Wasatch and Uintas.  The float is amazing in powder and the camber allows you to ride through the chop or breakable crust often encountered when exiting backcountry lines. Fun and nimble in the trees.  Awesome for opening it up in bowls.
review.name: Banger!

name: Backwoods Carbon Splitboard - 2025

review.itemreviewed: Limitless - Stretch Waistband High-Rise Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I LOVE these pants! They are so comfortable to ride in. The waistband is my favorite feature, since it is stretchy and comfy with a hip pack on. I am anywhere between a 8-12 in pants, and I got the 12. The 10 fit me, but they were a bit too tight for riding. I got the rainbow ombre and it is amazing! Shredly nailed the colors, and I get compliments every time I wear them. The fabric is on the heavy side, so if you are planning on wearing these in a hot climate I might get something lighter. I have worn these hiking, camping, and just chilling with cute sneakers and a jean jacket. Get these pants!
review.name: Great pants!

name: Limitless - Stretch Waistband High-Rise Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoes for walking my dogs. One pair of Gore-Tex and 2 regular will see me through anything.
review.name: Bought my 3rd pair of challengers

review.reviewBody: I am a 58-year-old female who enjoys trail walking about 3.5 miles a day. I have high arches and troubled feet with a bunion and occasional plantar fasciitis. I also have a wider foot base with a thinner heel, which makes it difficult to find the right shoe, especially in women's. I have worn Saucony, Brooks, Asics, Nike, Under Armour, OnCloud, Ryka, Addidas & more, but NOTHING compares to the comfort of the Hoka Challenger 7's!! They fit perfectly for my foot shape, provide great arch support and wear like a pair of good shock absorbers. AND... the best part is that twigs, rocks, & other debris from the woods doesn't get stuck in the treads of the shoes! LOVE THEM!
review.name: Just What My Feet Needed!

review.reviewBody: I bought Hoka tennis shoes. Hi bought them used. They were great shape and package well.
review.name: I love what I ordered and YES, would buy the product again !

review.reviewBody: Shoes are a lot lighter green in person. I was expecting the color on the website and was disappointed. They are my first Hokas and they are cushiony and lightweight but seem just as good as my Brooks. They are also big so maybe size down from your usual.
review.name: Pretty okay

review.reviewBody: Bought these for building my trail mileage for an upcoming fall marathon. Went full send and wore them on a 16 mile run for my first miles in them and was pleasantly surprised to be moderately comfortable. However, in the following days during my shorter runs, I developed really sharp pain in my left arch while running or even just walking around. This has happened to me in the Speed Goats, so I'm lead to believe this might be a common thing for me with Hokas? Luckily I had some currex insoles to throw in, and that felt a lot better on my most recent run. Hopefully that's a permanent fix.... Otherwise, I've enjoyed the shoes! They don't feel super stable on my local trails (some rocky sections), but it's fine if I stay alert.
review.name: Comfy out of the box, but needed new insoles

review.reviewBody: Got this on sale, and didn’t realized it had a pair of nail clippers (feels super heavy duty, BD needs to get into the personal hygiene industry). It’s been great to have as a way to fix little nicks and scratches obtained at work, and to trim my fingernails/fix them up when I regularly forget to. The little baggy is nifty too, great for flexing on coworkers and bystanders at the trailhead.
review.name: Great little kit for travel and work

review.reviewBody: Well built. Great little kit to through in your gear bag with essentials for maintaining your skin in between sessions

review.reviewBody: The precut skinny tape has neat edges and a uniform width. I like it! Easy to use. The nail cutters are sharp, sturdy and, interestingly, straight edged and not crescent shaped; they are easier to use not having to line up the curved shape one cut to the next. There is a efficient micro file built into the lever part of the clippers too.
review.name: Precut tape is neat and clippers novel

review.reviewBody: Just love everything inside. Good tape. Good quality nail clippers, the polishing cube does more than i thought
review.name: Best value combination on the market

review.reviewBody: This is a great to start your skin care kit, or to put all creams, finger massagers, etc. great gift for my climbing friends during the holidays

Bless up!

review.reviewBody: Great kit to keep things organized. Room in the bag for other items if needed.
