review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Lace Up WP Bootie - Women's
review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Women's ThermoBall Lace Up Waterproof Boots by Northface and am thrilled with my purchase. These boots have become my new go-to for staying warm and stylish during winter. First and foremost, the waterproof feature of these boots is a game changer. I never worry about my feet getting wet or cold while walking through snow or slush. The ThermoBall insulation keeps my feet nice and toasty even on the coldest days, which is perfect for someone like me who is always cold. The lace-up design adds a trendy touch to the boots and allows for a customizable fit. I can tighten or loosen the laces to ensure my feet are comfortable and secure. The high-top design also provides extra ankle support, which is excellent for someone like me who tends to roll my ankles easily. In terms of style, these boots are a perfect combination of cute and functional. The sleek black color goes with everything in my wardrobe. I have received so many compliments on these boots and have even had friends ask me where they can get a pair for themselves. Overall, I highly recommend the Women's ThermoBall Lace Up Waterproof Boots by Northface to anyone needing a reliable and stylish pair of winter boots. They are comfortable, warm, and fashionable, making them a must-have for the colder months. I am beyond satisfied with my purchase and will be looking into other Northface products in the future.
review.name: I would Recommend this product all of my girlfriends

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Lace Up WP Bootie - Women's
review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Women's ThermoBall Lace Up Waterproof Boots in my usual size 6, but unfortunately, they were too narrow at the opening, making it quite a struggle to put them on and take them off. I ended up having to exchange them for a size 7, which worked better since there are no half sizes available. On the plus side, the boots are stylish and really pretty, which is a definite win! If have wider feet or fall in between sizes, they will not be a great choice for you. I do recommend, just keep in mind the sizing issue. Overall, they're nice/beautiful boots!
review.name: Stylish but Sizing Issues

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Lace Up WP Bootie - Women's
review.reviewBody: I recommend these winter boots, they are the best I have ever bought
review.name: The best boots

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Lace Up WP Bootie - Women's
review.reviewBody: Will be using these for my Colorado trip in December. I've tried them on at home and they're warm and comfortable.
review.name: Would purchase again

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Lace Up WP Bootie - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this boot for last winter and I love them. It's very cozy and warm, perfect for me! I will say that it's a little tight to put it on and it doesn't have any zipper or you can't just slide your feet in it. Other than that it's perfect, I always get so many compliments bc it looks so good
review.name: I love mine

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Lace Up WP Bootie - Women's

The second brief had none of the problems. It hand washed fine in the same washing powder and, when dried, was perfectly fine.

review.reviewBody: Have been using these for week. Between the two pairs of lenses included, they've been fantastic in all conditions. Best goggles I've ever had.
review.name: Love the lens choices!

review.reviewBody: Going on 4 seasons with the 4D MAG. The original goggles I purchased are still in great shape after many, many days… The lenses are still free of scratches which is a minor mirical given how much time I spend skiing trees. Integration with my helmet i seamless, very little to no gap up front and the vents in the helment help to ensure airflow though the top of the goggles to help ensure they stay fog free. The only time I’ve gotten these to fog were operator error on my behalf that came after a long bootpack where I had built up too much heat that overcame all efforts to vent. Otherwise the do exactly what they are supposed to, provide clear vision and protection in inclement or bright sunny weather conditions.
review.name: The most important part of my kit (short of my Smith helmet)

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn Oakley goggles for 30 years, used my new smith goggles on a 7 day ski traverse and loved them. Nice work smith!
review.name: I’ve worn Oakley goggles for

review.reviewBody: Purchased at end of my ski season…have to wait to Dec to try on the slopes….but so far it is great, even better than my years old Smith MAG.
review.name: 4D MAG great so far

review.reviewBody: Great breadth of vision, lens ideal for many types of weather, great fit!
review.name: New goggles = happy

review.reviewBody: I have a very small nose and was worried about them fitting me. The are so far the bes goggles I have ever owned. I’m also very happy with the radiance of the color when I’m skiing.
review.name: Awesom

review.reviewBody: I had the I/O mag S and felt they were just a touch too small so I thought I would try these. I love the shape of the 4D Mag lens and love the definition that the lenses give. I have the yellow storm which is great on stormy days in the PNW. However, I am getting some fogging which I don't have with the I/O Mag S. Wish there was an S version on the 4D Mag
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: These goggles have ruined two of my ski trips this season. They keep fogging up and freezing. There is also water stuck in between the layers of the lens. I had to keep going into the lodge to try and de-fog.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
fit great//superb field of vison
--the dark lens even perfect on an overcast day
--could not be happier, love the protective microfiber sleeve..
review.name: fit great//superb field of vison

review.reviewBody: air seems to be coming in the sides. not sure how to stop this, aside from the fact that maybe they are too big for me. however that is not what i was told at a ski shop. i like the 4D, i miss the fit of my i/o.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Teva Canyonview RP Hiking Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these lightweight waterproof shoes for a trip. Haven't been on my trip yet but I have been using them to walk my dog on the rain and they are wonderful. I have s foot issues and hated to hug another pair of shoes that don't feel good but these have been comfortable from day one. And they keep my feet dry! I would definitely buy them again. When I measured my foot the recommendation was to I buy a size 7 which I did but the shoe was too short. Returned for a size 7.5 which fits perfectly
review.name: Excellent choice

review.reviewBody: This was my first time buying a Teva closed shoe vs. sandal. I am very happy with them.
review.name: All day comfort, great style

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable for walking. Great for all day walking and standing. Plenty of "Cush" but firm enough to hold up for a long time. You knocked it out of the park again Teva!
review.name: I would purchase more if there were more colors!

review.reviewBody: I have lots of troubles with my feet, including bunions and arthritis, and I have struggled to find a shoe that I can wear all day long - until now! I bought these shoes for a trip to Ireland. I wanted something waterproof but not too hot, and comfortable for city walking and for trail hiking, and these did not disappoint! They were comfortable from the moment I put them on, and my feet felt great the entire trip. I did a lot of walking, a couple of days were 8-10 miles of rough terrain walking each day, a some days were all-day city walking, and my feet never bothered me. Some of the days were rainy, but my feet always stayed dry in these shoes. All throughout the trip I kept telling my husband how great my feet felt! I would definitely recommend these shoes!
review.name: Most comfortable hiking shoe I've ever owned!

review.reviewBody: Love the look, feel, and overall comfort/stability. The fabric is a little scratchy feeling, and the tongue of the shoe irritated me for a few days. I wouldn't go straight hiking in them - need a little time to soften them up.
review.name: A litte stiff/scratchy, but otherwise amazing

review.reviewBody: I love the color, style and feel of my new Tevas. But for my next purchase, I would appreciate a bit more cushion in the mid sole since I have metatarsal issues.
review.name: They feel great

review.reviewBody: I just got back from Scotland where you just never know when it is going to rain. We also did a lot of street walking and nature hikes. These were amazing!! My feet were never wet and I never got blisters. Great support and tread. I would recommend these to everyone! Can't wait to use them all summer hiking.
review.name: Great for travel

review.reviewBody: Well made product and loved the color. Very comfortable hiking shoe.
review.name: Great walking hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: I've been attempting to break these in for several weeks, but they still give me Achilles tendon blisters within minutes of putting them on, even through thick socks. They also put pressure on my inner arch. Other than that construction and waterproofing is good.
review.name: Rubs ankle badly

review.reviewBody: I have bouth Teva prior but this actual shoe was too tight :(
review.name: toe bed too narrow for my foot

name: Canyonview RP Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is my second Mackage purchase, Love the coat. I literally wear my mackage jackets with short sleeves underneath and do not feel anything. Only downside is the worksmanship when it comes to the inside zipper part if you like to wear your coat open with just the inside zipper, zipped any slight move or tug both sides of the jacket unravels. Ive only had this coat for a month and a half and that happened to me. Love the jacket but dislike that i spend so much money on something for that too happen

However the only downfall to this jacket is the neck area. It’s made out of fabric that will start to get destroyed by wearing it overtime. It’ll start to have balls on it and look worn out when the jacket would look new. So no point of spending this much money on a jacket like this.

review.reviewBody: I wear these literally every day, even when it's not sunny. The frame is crazy light, stays put during sweaty hikes/bumpy downhills, chromapop lenses make me feel like a superhero and the small shape fits my face. I had them for four years before the frame recently broke and Smith covered it with their warranty. One thing to note, this shape does let in light when fishing, so depending on the time of day you're on the water, expect some glare.
review.name: If my house was on fire, I would grab these

review.reviewBody:
I bought these as a gift for my husband, I wasn't sure if they would look too feminine as there are really not great pics on the website of men or women wearing the glasses. Smith - this would really be great to add. 

We got lucky, as we live in Rwanda, and did not have to return them as they fit his face perfectly. He enjoys the chromapop feature the best as it enhances the colors. They are very comfortable and they also look good on me when I forget mine and need to steal his. Great glasses overall.
review.name: Versatile Style

review.reviewBody: Converted from Costa Brand. Anticipate a better support program! My occupation requires me to be outside daily therefore I wear sunglasses a significant amount of days and are looking for a product that can stand up to the daily abuse. I hope these are the one!
review.name: Converted from Costa Brand. Anticipate

review.reviewBody: I love my Eastbanks! The fit is super comfortable. The frames also have no problem staying on my face regardless of what I’m doing. I also love the quality of the lenses.
review.name: My Go-To Sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
The fit is good for my smaller face shape but the nose pieces do dig in a bit which becomes uncomfortable during longer duration activities. 
I chose the Polarized ChromaPop Opal Mirror lenses and found they have a glare. The tint is super heavy on the yellow - which I thought I’d like previously having the Bronze colored lens. 
The Founder Slims were by far the best frames for me and I miss the old lenses. Would love to see these back in the line up for smaller face frames. 
I’m still convinced Smith has some of the best tech and quality around, and an excellent warranty program that absolutely justifies the cost.
review.name: Still looking

review.reviewBody: Lunettes légères et confortables d’une clareté remarquable. Suite au décollement d’un coussinet j’ai pu constater que le service après-vente est rapide et efficace.
review.name: Lunettes légères et confortables d’une

review.reviewBody:
2022 UPDATE: 6 yrs later, they're still in excellent condition (skiing 10-20 days/yr), passing them on to my niece, still stand by everything written below - these are awesome! Bought my now-teen girl some Patrol Gauntlet MItts to keep the Hestra vibes going

Short Story: crazy warm, high quality, awesome features, cool colors, you won't regret it

Details: Bought these in pink for my 8 yr old last season & she loves them. To be honest, I'm totally jealous  ... I need my own pair ... soon. She loves that the insides are insanely comfy & warm. I love the carabiner clip, wrist leashes, gauntlets & top notch construction. Seriously, it's awesome to NOT have to hold her mitts on the lift while we adjust gear, & the gauntlets make it easy to keep out the snow. No more taking off my gloves in the freezing cold to pull her jacket sleeves over her gloves every 15 minutes. (frankly, that always bothered me way more than her, but at least I'm not doing it now) 

As for style, she's cautious about looking TOO girly & loves these bc they're cute but rugged looking. I've compared them to the adult Heli's in store & they're obviously the same top quality. These things rock. After 1 season, they barely show any wear. If you're skiing in the rain, maybe the goat leather isn't the most waterproof protection on the market, but I rarely ski in the rain & especially not w the kid. They've been rock solid & plenty waterproof when we've been in wet snow/spring conditions & dried pretty quickly. These aren't made for snowball fights in wet snow, they're made to keep you warm in nasty alpine conditions. Why would you send the kids outside to play in mitts anyway? Get a cheap pair of synthetic waterproof gloves for that, then pack them in your gear bag as back-up. Buy these mitts so your kids' cold hands don't ruin your (& their) expensive ski trip. Plus, I bought them a little big, so I expect a couple more seasons & (since they're the gold standard) I bet I can then sell them for $50 to put towards a new pair. In the long run, I doubt they'll actually cost much more than the mediocre, practically disposable gloves I used to buy.

Get these & never worry about their hands again. Yes, they're expensive, but I never have to go in early bc my kid's hands are cold ... so I've got that going for me ... which is nice.

(does she look excited to be at the Okemo summit for the 1st time??)
review.name: These Mitts Rock

name: Heli Ski Junior Mitten - Kids'

review.itemreviewed: UMA GT Spring Fall Half-Tights - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have other cycling tights.    I have several pairs that are light and I wear these in the spring and fall when it is relatively warm.      I also have a very heavy fleecy windproof tight.    I wear that one when it is cold -  like 30's and 40's.    So,  I wanted and needed something in the middle like when it is the high 40's and  low to mid 50's.            I know these European road cycling  brands their sizing is small.    So,   I ordered up one size from my usual size which is small, and got the medium.  The medium fit like a small in other brands.     In fact, it fit me perfectly, including the length and I am petite.    There is no zipper at the bottom of the pant just so you know.
review.name: What I was looking for and wanted

review.reviewBody: Please, please, please don’t stop making this shoe. It’s so frustrating when you finally find something you like and then they stop making it. This shoe is the best. Best price, best fit, and it looks good (at least the army green version). I’ve tried shoes that cost twice as much and nothing is as good. Plenty of toe room, and the heel doesn’t slip. It even has enough room in case you want to put in a thicker insole, and the heel doesn’t slip even with that. Okay, if I would change anything, it’s the weird cut in the toe protection; I don’t know why that is there. But this shoe is amazing, and the price makes it perfect.
review.name: THE BEST SHOE EVER

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoes, comfortable right out of the box. Very breathable. Wish they were still available.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair, the fit is consistent with every other pair of Keens I’ve had. Last year I walked around 30 miles a week (80/20 pavement to trail) the shoes held up most of the summer. And they handled rough trails and some cross country really well. I wore out the insoles 1st, and preemptively ordered a pair to change out in a few months. The soles could be more long lived as well.
review.name: Hybrid trail runner/hiker

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Usual K fit, nice and lite, good tread. Just right for warm weather hiking.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
Overall, the KEEN NXIS Speed is a great shoe. It's comfortable. 

It would have been nice if the shoe was available in a size12.5,
review.name: Good shoe. But I needed a 12.5

review.reviewBody: These shoes are amazing, just like all the other Keen products. Been wearing them for years never had an issue.
review.name: These shoes are amazing, just

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am on my 2nd pair of these now. The toe is hard enough for kneeling on and protection. The sole is plush and nice to be on your feet all day. They are more breathable than any leather shoe. Great for light duty work days.
review.name: Best work sneaker

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second pair of these shoes and they are as great as the first pair. I'll be buying a third pair of the NXIS in a few more days. These shoes are the greatest fitting and feeling shoes I've ever owned.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.reviewBody: Got these for my father and he loved them straight out of the box and wore them on a two week trip to Europe. Great walking shoes with excellent support.
review.name: Dad Approved

review.reviewBody: My everyday shoe, short hikes and wear around town. Very comfortable on my foot.
review.name: Super Comfortable

name: NXIS Speed Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Race Face Oval Cinch Direct Mount Traction Chainring
review.reviewBody: Can’t say for sure the oval makes a difference. I put it on at the beginning of the season so no direct comparison but the quality is 5 stars. No dropped chains or slipping.
review.name: Top Quality

review.itemreviewed: Race Face Oval Cinch Direct Mount Traction Chainring
review.reviewBody: If you don’t know about your pedal stroke, it’s likely you’re doing it wrong. If that true, this ring will fix it and you will notice it immediately. Not every oval ring is created the same either, go with absolute black for its strong/lightweight/and creative design. You’ll be hard pressed to find an $80 upgrade that makes this much difference!
review.name: Game Changer

name: Race Face Oval Cinch Direct Mount Traction Chainring

review.reviewBody: I realize this is a light boot and I treated it like a regular full duty boot. I have to keep gluing the toe and side fabric back on the rubber side walls.  They look real beat up fabric is stained. These boots currently live in by truck tool bin for emergency use. Still very comfortable.
review.name: I really like the ultra light boot

review.reviewBody: When searching under women's boots this item appears, although it says Men's boot. I contacted customer service and no one could tell me if the sizes are men's or women's. After 30 mins on the call, I was told they all think it is women's sizes. I ordered my size, 7. It arrived today. No, it is not a woman's size. It is a men's 7 which is a woman's 8.5. I now I have to ship it back.  Be aware, even though it appears under women's search it is sized for men.
review.name: Confusing Sizes

name: Pampa Travel Lite Boot

review.reviewBody: There snowsuits are amazing & warm . My grandchildren love them ! The mittens that go with it are a must !! Super warm & stays dry !!
review.name: Snowsuit

review.reviewBody: This is the second Ive bought! Very worth the $$ . Truly waterproof but does not make my kiddo sweat! She can put it in independently and stays nice and warm. Good quality so it lasts several years (and several children)
review.name: 100% worth it

review.reviewBody: My kids love these and they definitely keep them warm for outdoor play at temperatures of -15 C for more then an hour. Getting into them is easier than the standard 2 piece snowsuit.
review.name: Will buy again!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the snowsuits! Great quality and are super cute!!
review.name: Snowsuits

review.reviewBody: We live in Montana and this suit has already made getting my daughter dressed and out the door so easy. She takes it to school too and throws it on before recess. I highly recommend it! Also, it is a very nice size and I have a large 5 year old. I do believe it’ll fit for more than this season though. Tough material, beautiful color, super warm!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: We love all that we purchased. What great quality. The warmth this snowsuit has, I know I wont worry about my grandaughter being cold.
review.name: Beautiful

review.reviewBody: Thank you so much. The product is extremely good quality and warm. Just the size we ordered was 3 but it is as big as 4 or 5. I will save it for future use :)
review.name: Loved the Product

review.reviewBody:
Love it! Love that it is waterproof and the hood is detachable. I say it fits slightly oversized, but more baggy- like space for layering up though. 

Only improvement would be reinforced knees.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: My 2 year old recently started forest school and we had our first big cold/snow day- 25degree and 6inches of snow. I felt nervous dropping my little one off but I received a message a few hours later from his teacher... my son was rolling around in the snow having a ball! He wasn't cold and didn't complain at all. I felt so relieved and happy that I purchased this snowsuit!
review.name: Forest school approved

review.reviewBody:
Reima never disappoints!! As a Scandinavian family in upstate New York we spend a lot of time outdoors in all sorts of weather.
My 4 year old attends an outdoor school where he’s outdoors in nature 7 hours a day no matter the temperature or amounts of snow, sleet and ice. The Stavanger suit kept him toasty all winter long. His teachers even said that he was the only one that was always dry and always warm! 

I have washed the suit countless times but you would never now, comes out of the washer like new every time.

Reima clothing lasts a lifetime and can be passed down to siblings, cousins and other little friends. Our last suit was previously used by 4 children and it still looks like new! 

Reima is truly the absolute best quality for families that enjoy the outdoors no matter the weather.
review.name: Keeps your kiddo warm no matter the weather

name: Stavanger Snow Suit - Kids'
